info.description: API to create the issuance of a mixed payment Letter of Credit
info.title: Issuance of Mixed Payment Letter of Credits

parameters.name: validate_only
parameters.description: The identifier to indicate if it is set to only validate or not.

responseCode.description: The user input to accept/reject the override.

applicantAddresses.description: Indicates the name and address of the applicant of the LC.

applicantAddress.description: Indicates the name and address of the applicant of the LC.

beneficiaryAddresses.description: The address of the Beneficiary if the customer number of the Beneficiary is not known

beneficiaryAddress.description: The address of the Beneficiary if the customer number of the Beneficiary is not known

advisingBankAddresses.description: Identifies the name and address of the advising bank under the LC, through whom Letter of Credit to be advised to second advisng bank or beneficiary.

advisingBankAddress.description: Identifies the name and address of the advising bank under the LC, through whom Letter of Credit to be advised to second advisng bank or beneficiary.

adviseThroughBanks.description: Indicates the second advising bank under the LC, through whom Letter of Credit is advised to beneficiary. They act as an intermediary between advising bank and the beneficairy.

adviseThroughBank.description: Indicates the second advising bank under the LC, through whom Letter of Credit is advised to beneficiary. They act as an intermediary between advising bank and the beneficairy.

availableWithBanks.description: Indicates the bank name and address that is authorised to pay, accept, or negotiate document presented under the letter of credit

availableWithBank.description: Indicates the bank name and address that is authorised to pay, accept, or negotiate document presented under the letter of credit

chargeCurrency.description: Holds the currency code of the charge account from where the fee is deducted

chargeAmount.description: Holds the charge amount equivalent in charge account currency

limitReference.description: Identifies the type of limit applicable to the Account

importMixedPmtLCType.description: Identifies the Import Mixed payment type of LC

lcNumber.description: Identifies the banks LCs number (or reference of the L/C from legacy system)

applicantCustomer.description: Indicates the  applicant on whose behalf the Letter of Credit is issued.

lcCurrency.description: Denote the currency of the Letter of Credit.

lcAmount.description: This field indicates the amount of the Letter of Credit that will always be expressed in the currency of Letter of Credit.

creditTolerance.description: This field defines the tolerance percentage to be added to the letter of credit amount to calculate the full liability amount or maximum amount that can be drawn.

debitTolerance.description: This field defines the negative tolerance percentage under the letter of credit, to calculate the minimum amount that can be presented under the LC.

issueDate.description: The date the item was issued.

expiryDate.description: The date an agreement such as a credit facility or limit is due to expire

expiryPlace.description: Expiry place for presentation under the documentary credit.

liabilityReversalDate.description: Date on which the contigent entries and the limits raised on the LC will be reversed.

daysAndPeriodForPresentation.description: Secifies the number of calendar days after the date of shipment within which the documents must be presented for payment, acceptance or negotiation.

shipmentDate.description: Latest date for loading on board/dispatch/taking in charge for goods shipped under the LC

modeOfShipment.description: Defining the mode of shipment allowed for transporting the goods and service under the LC.

incoTerms.description: This field holds the valid incoterms code

limitReference.description: Identifies the type of limit applicable to the Account

autoExpiry.description: Decision field to determine whether the contingent entries are to be reversed after the deal expiry date or not

beneficiaryCustomerId.description: The customer identifier where the beneficiary is a customer of the bank

advisingBankId.description: It’s a system populated field which default the advising bank ID, name and address from the LC contract.

adviseThroughBank.description: Indicates the second advising bank under the LC, through whom Letter of Credit is advised to beneficiary. They act as an intermediary between advising bank and the beneficairy.

availableWithBankId.description: Indicates the bank ID that is authorised to pay, accept, or negotiate document presented under the letter of credit

reimbursingBank.description: Identifies the reimbursing bank ID under the LC, through whom reimbursement will be made to the paying/negotiating bank for a letter of credit. (Reimbursing bank should be a valid customer with customer ID)

waiveCharge.description: Defines whether charges are to be collected or waived

marginRequired.description: Decision field if margin to be blocked for the LC contract or not.

releaseProvision.description: Field to decide whether the provision should be released or not

marginCalculationBase.description: This field determines if the margin to be calculated based on the LC amount or the total liability amount.

marginPercent.description: Field to state the percentage of provision to be taken

marginDebitAccount.description: Field to state the account from which the provision amount is to be debited

marginAmount.description: Actual amount of provision that is debited for the transaction

marginExchangeRate.description: This Field determines the exchange rate to be used between the provision debit account and the provision credit account, when the currencies differ

limitWithProvision.description: This field determines if the margin calculated to be debited after considering the limits booked under the LC contract

id.description: The Identifier of the record created

T24_time.description: Time taken to response by T24

parse_time.description: Time taken to parse the response by IRIS
